docinfo.docinfo:doc-heading: PART 5 COSTS IN COAL MINERS’ WORKERS COMPENSATION LIST AND SPECIAL STATUTORY COMPENSATION LIST MATTERS [rr 46–59]

heading.title: [Sch 11] SCHEDULE 11 PROVISIONS REGARDING PROCEDURE IN CERTAIN LISTS IN THE DISTRICT COURT
PART 5 COSTS IN COAL MINERS’ WORKERS COMPENSATION LIST AND SPECIAL STATUTORY COMPENSATION LIST MATTERS [rr 46–59]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [Sch 11] SCHEDULE 11 PROVISIONS REGARDING PROCEDURE IN CERTAIN LISTS IN THE DISTRICT COURT
PART 5 COSTS IN COAL MINERS’ WORKERS COMPENSATION LIST AND SPECIAL STATUTORY COMPENSATION LIST MATTERS [rr 46–59]

leg:heading.title: COSTS IN COAL MINERS’ WORKERS COMPENSATION LIST AND SPECIAL STATUTORY COMPENSATION LIST MATTERS [rr 46–59]

p.text: The provisions of this Part apply subject to their terms, to proceedings entered in the Coal Miners’ Workers Compensation List and the Special Statutory Compensation List in respect of costs payable or to be assessed under any order of the Court or under these rules.
Where there is an inconsistency in the operation of these rules and the provisions of this Part the provisions of this Part shall apply.
The application of these rules and of this Part is subject to:

the
District Court Act 1973
, and
the Workers Compensation Acts and the regulations made under those Acts, and
a Special Statutory Compensation Act and the regulations made under that Act, and

the
Legal Profession Act 2004
and the regulations made under that Act.

In this Part, and unless the context or subject matter otherwise indicates or requires, a reference to costs is a reference to costs payable between party and party in respect of proceedings, including disbursements.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 48 Time for dealing with costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 3)

leg:heading.title: Time for dealing with costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 3)

p.text: The Court may in any proceedings exercise its powers and discretions as to costs at any stage of the proceedings or after the conclusion of the proceedings.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 49 Claimant’s costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 4)

p.text: Where in any proceedings the Court makes a final order, or gives a final decision, in favour of the claimant, the claimant shall, unless the Court otherwise orders, be entitled to recover the claimant’s costs of the proceedings against the employer against whom the final order or decision was made or given.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 50 Redemption cases (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 5)

p.text:
Where an employer commences proceedings for redemption under
section 15
of the Workers’ Compensation Act 1926, as preserved by
Part 18
of Schedule 6 to the Workers Compensation Act 1987, with the consent of the claimant, the employer shall, unless the Court otherwise orders, pay the costs of the claimant of the proceedings whatever be the result of the proceedings.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 51 Costs where other proceedings (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 6)

leg:heading.title: Costs where other proceedings (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 6)

p.text: Where in any proceedings a claimant is entitled to recover costs against an employer or insurer, those costs shall not be reduced or apportioned because any part of them was incurred also in respect of proceedings under the Uninsured Liability and Indemnity Scheme, or in respect of proceedings against another person against whom no award has been made, except to the extent that any such part has been received by the claimant.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 52 Assessed costs and other provisions (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 7)

leg:heading.title: Assessed costs and other provisions (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 7)

p.text: Subject to this Part, where, by or under these rules or any order of the Court, costs are to be paid to any person, that person shall be entitled to assessed costs.

Where the Court orders that costs be paid to any person, the Court may, at any time prior to the costs being referred for assessment, further order that, as to the whole or any part (specified in the order) of the costs, instead of assessed costs, that person shall be entitled to:
a proportion specified in the order of the assessed costs, or
the assessed costs from or up to a stage of the proceedings specified in the order, or
a gross sum specified in the order instead of the assessed costs.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 53 Preliminary discovery (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 8)

p.text:
The Court may in any proceedings require any person to pay the costs of any party of proceedings under
Part 5
of these rules (Preliminary discovery and inspection) in respect of those proceedings including payments of conduct money and payments on account of expenses and loss under that Part.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 54 Agreement as to costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 9)

leg:heading.title: Agreement as to costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 9)

p.text: Where costs are payable by one party to another, those parties may agree as to the amount of the costs.

An amount of costs agreed to under
subclause (1)
shall not be included in any process of enforcement unless the agreement is embodied in a form of order bearing the consent of the party required to pay the costs and lodged for the signature of the registrar.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 55 Agreement as to part of costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 10)

leg:heading.title: Agreement as to part of costs (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 10)

p.text: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, where costs are payable by one party to another, the parties may agree as to the amount of those costs payable in respect of any item or items of work done.

An amount of costs agreed to under
subclause (1)
shall not be included in any process of enforcement unless the agreement is embodied in a form of order bearing the consent of the party required to pay the costs and lodged for the signature of the registrar.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 56 When costs payable (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 11)

leg:heading.title: When costs payable (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 11)

p.text: Where, before the conclusion of any proceedings, the Court makes an order for the payment of costs or a motion is refused with costs, the costs shall not, unless the Court otherwise orders, be payable until after the conclusion of the proceedings.

Where, in any proceedings, it appears to the registrar, on application, that there is no likelihood of any further order being made in the proceedings, the registrar may order that any costs ordered to be paid shall be payable forthwith.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 57 Party and party basis (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 12)

leg:heading.title: Party and party basis (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 12)

p.text: Costs payable by or under these rules or any order of the Court shall be payable on a party and party basis unless these rules or an order provide that they are payable on an indemnity basis.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 58 Indemnity basis (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 13)

p.text: On an assessment on the indemnity basis, all costs shall be allowed except in so far as they are of an unreasonable amount or have been unreasonably incurred, and any doubts which the assessor may have as to whether the costs were reasonably incurred or were reasonable in amount shall be resolved in favour of the receiving party.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: cl 59 Costs order to confirm earlier costs orders (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 14)

leg:heading.title: Costs order to confirm earlier costs orders (cf DCR Part 39B, rule 14)

p.text: An order as to costs made in proceedings after 30 June 1994 shall unless the Court otherwise orders, be taken to expressly confirm all earlier orders as to costs made in the proceedings.
